Posts.Content: Thanks for replying ,Chuck. I was diagnosed as Stage 2B . I asked the urologist if it ia possible the PC has spread to the lymph nodes and would a CT scan pick that up and he said no. Should I request a CT scan anyway and would it pick up anything in the tissues or seminal vessels? I am being a sponge right now absorbing info .Look forward to your reply Regards, Ron
Posts.Title: Just got diagnosed. now what?

Posts.Content: Looking for opinions.I am a healthy,active 62 year old. Had my physical in August and showed a PSA level of 7.6. Sent to uroligist . Had a Cyscoscopy and a biopsy.Biopsy showed 6 out of 12 tissue samples positive with a gleason score 0f 4 + 4 =8. Had Bone Scan on Nov 14th with follow up visit on Nov 29 2013. Bone Scan was negative so now I have choices of treatments. What do I do ? Surgery, Radiation or .... I am supposed to meet with doctor on Dec 9th and form a plan of attack. Merry Xmas. Your thoughts???
Posts.Title: Just got diagnosed. now what?

Posts.Content: Thanks Debbie, Appreciate the support. Lots of good info and people on this site. Regards, Ron

Posts.Content: Hi Bob, I am asking the pros and cons of Robotic Davinci surgery as opposed to the original way of 8 inch incision and surgeon going in. Originally Posted by Bob_R Hey Ronny, Welcome and sorry you are here, I am confused by you thread title, are you asking about da vinci and radiation? because Da vinci and RP are the same thing. I can't talk with authority on radiation therapy but a have under taken the da vinci. The decision is a difficult one and I recommend you understand the impacts and benefits of any procedure you take. Anyway if you can just clarify what you really want with details folk here will jump in
Posts.Title: Need opinions on Da vinci or radical prostatectomy

Posts.Content: I am attending a program at Vancouver Prostate Centre for newly diagnosed patients on Dec 11th. At that program there will be specialists in urology and radiation oncology. They want my lab reports before attending to assess my situation. I am Stage 2B Gleason 4 +4 =8 Biopsy 6 out of 12 samples positive. PSA 7.6. Bone Scan Negative.62 years old I am leaning towards Davinci as I am on my own with no family near me. I hear recovery is quicker and less invasive surgery. I would like your opinions before I attend this seminar. Much Thanks, Ronny B
